Until the spell ends, the target's speed is tripled, it gains a +3 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains two additional actions on each of its turns. These actions can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

For the duration, the target also has resistance to radiant damage, has advantage on weapon attack rolls, and deals {@dice 1d6} bonus radiant damage when it hits with a weapon attack. In addition, it can use a bonus action on its turn to teleport in a flash of light up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

When the spell ends, the target falls {@condition prone} and is both {@condition stunned} and {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn, as a wave of lethargy and electricity, and pain sweeps over it.
A creature affected by this spell gains no benefit from the haste spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Storm God's Haste}}

spell.name: White Flame Haste
entries: You touch a willing creature and invest it with the essence of rapid flash fire. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is tripled, it gains a +3 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains two additional actions on each of its turns. These actions can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

For the duration, the target also has resistance to fire damage, has advantage on weapon attack rolls, and deals {@dice 1d6} bonus fire damage when it hits with a weapon attack. In addition, it can use a bonus action on its turn to teleport in a flash of fire up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space that it can see.

When the spell ends, the target falls {@condition prone} and is both {@condition stunned} and {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn, as a wave of lethargy and electricity, and pain sweeps over it.
A creature affected by this spell gains no benefit from the haste spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Storm God's Haste}}

spell.name: Freezing Icicle
entries: You form a spear of ice, which you use to either make one melee spell attack against a target within 5 feet of you or one ranged spell attack against a target that you can see within range. Then the spear dissolves.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d8 + 20} cold damage, and if it isn't immune to the damage, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it falls {@condition prone} and becomes {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition stunned} for the duration. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a miss, the target takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects from the spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Storm Spear}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Elemental Comet
entries: You beckon an elemental comet to descend from above and strike the ground in a freezing explosion at a point you can see within range. Each creature within a 30-foot sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 1d10} cold damage and {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

After impact, the freezing comet lurches out of its crater, awakens, and separates into an ice elemental and a fog elemental each of which disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. Each of the elementals takes bludgeoning damage equal to half its maximum hit points from the impact. Creatures in the ice elemental's space are pushed away from the center of the impact point until they are completely outside the elemental's space.

The elementals are friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elementals, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you} If you don't issue any commands to the elementals, they defend themselves from hostile creatures but otherwise take no actions.

If your concentration is broken, the elementals don't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elementals, they become hostile toward you and your companions, and they might attack. An uncontrolled elemental can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

The DM has the elementals' statistics. This spell deals double damage to objects and structures in the area of the meteor impact. Additionally, ground within the area becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Each 5- foot-diameter portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Elemental Meteor}}

spell.name: Astral Flare
entries: You launch a beam of starlight at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 20} radiant damage and {@damage 4d8 + 20} force damage. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn, and if you choose so, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 30 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
On a miss, the target takes half damage and it isn't {@condition stunned}, pushed, or knocked {@condition prone}.
If the target is an object, it automatically fails any saving throws for this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fist of Flame|TEB}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level the radiant and force damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Fulmination
entries: You launch a bolt of roaring, thunderous lightning at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 20} lightning damage and {@damage 4d8 + 20} thunder damage. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn, {@condition deafened} for 1 minute, and if you choose so, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 50 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
On a miss, the target takes half damage and it isn't {@condition stunned}, pushed, or knocked {@condition prone}.
It repeats the Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
If the target is an object, it automatically fails any saving throws for this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fist of Flame}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the fire and bludgeoning damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Geode Gauntlet
entries: You conjure a huge spiked fist made from solid rock and crystal and throw it at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 20} nonmagical piercing damage and {@damage 4d8 + 20} bludgeoning damage. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn, and if you choose so, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 50 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
On a miss, the target takes half damage and it isn't {@condition stunned}, pushed, or knocked {@condition prone}.
If the target is an object, it automatically fails any saving throws for this spell. This spell always deal maximum damage to objects and structures.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fist of Flame}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the fire and bludgeoning damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Lancing Icicle
entries: You launch a jagged icicle at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 20} cold damage and {@damage 4d8 + 20} piercing damage. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn, and if you choose so, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 50 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
On a miss, the target takes half damage and it isn't {@condition stunned}, pushed, or knocked {@condition prone}.
If the target is an object, it automatically fails any saving throws for this spell.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Fist of Flame}}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the fire and bludgeoning damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Reverberating Weapon
entries: You touch a weapon and cause it to rumble and vibrate with loud bass when it is drawn. For the duration, it is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus thunder damage on a hit equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Spellcasting modifier.

When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, if the attack's target is a creature, it is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. It makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on a success.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Flaring Weapon}}

spell.name: Scintillating Weapon
entries: You touch a weapon and cause it to erupt with prismatic flashes of light when it is drawn. For the duration, the weapon emits bright light for 20 feet and dim light for another 20 feet while it is being held, it is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus radiant damage on a hit equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Spellcasting modifier.

When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, if the target is a creature, it must  succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Flaring Weapon}}

spell.name: Voltaic Weapon
entries: You touch a weapon and cause it to erupt with bright crackling lightning when it is drawn. For the duration, the weapon emits bright light for 20 feet and dim light for another 20 feet while it is being held, it is magical if it was not already, and attacks made with the weapon deal bonus lightning damage on a hit equal to {@dice 3d8} + your Spellcasting modifier.

When the weapon is used to score a critical hit or hit with an opportunity attack, if the attack's target is a creature, it has disadvantage on saving throws to maintain concentration resulting from the attack's damage and it can't take reactions or bonus actions until the end of its next turn.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Flaring Weapon}}

spell.name: Fetid Swamp Cloud
entries: A swirling cloud of gaseous green acid that smells foul and diseased appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Frigid Cloud
entries: A swirling cloud of icy white mist appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Thunderhead
entries: A swirling storm cloud with lightning rumbling within appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Scouring Sands
entries: A swirling cloud of abrasive sand that erodes those within appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} piercing damage and {@damage 5d8} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Solar Wind
entries: A swirling cloud of smoke filled with pulses of golden eldritch starlight appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.
The cloud sheds dim light in a 40-foot radius.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Incendiary Cloud}}

spell.name: Dissolving Spray

components.m: fire and a piece of sunstone

entries: A massive foamy wave of transparent acid appears in a 60-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that wave must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 12d6} acid damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded} by this spell. Constructs and elementals have disadvantage on this saving throw.
A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition blinded}.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Sunburst}}

spell.name: Lava Shield

components.m: a bit of solvent or a swamp frog

entries: You are surrounded by a swirling shield of protective boiling lava that doesn't damage you or your equipment. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits:
• You have resistance to cold damage.
• You can't be {@condition restrained} by nonmagical objects.
• Any creature that grapples you or begins its turn while grappling you takes {@damage 12d4} fire damage.
• Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you makes a melee attack against you, the creature has disadvantage on the attack, and it takes {@damage 8d4} fire damage before the attack hits or misses.

• When you are attacked with a weapon, the attack misses and the swirling lava consumes the weapon, incinerating it and destroying it. If ammunition was used, it is consumed instead. This doesn't happen if the weapon is magical or a natural weapon, or if the attack used magical ammunition.
A creature killed by this spell is incinerated.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Acid Ward|TEB}}

spell.name: Devouring Slime

m.text: a diamond worth at least 800 gp

entries: There is one possible use for the spell granting immediate effects.

You cast this spell using 1 action, the ground within 60 feet of a point that you choose within range is transformed into incredibly caustic and sticky acidic slime that extends 5 feet deep until the spell ends. The slime sheds bright light for 30 feet and dim light for an additional 30 feet beyond that. A creature walking on the slime must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves. Each creature that touches the slime for the first time on a turn must make a Dexterity saving throw, unless it is already {@condition restrained} by the slime. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 8d6} acid damage and is {@condition restrained} by the slime. On a success, it takes half damage and it isn't {@condition restrained}.

Each creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the lava or enters that area for the first time on a turn takes {@damage 4d6} acid damage, or {@damage 12d6} acid damage if it is {@condition restrained} by the slime. When a {@condition restrained} creature ends its turn, it sinks into the slime. In addition, whenever a creature falls {@condition prone} within the slime or ends its turn while {@condition prone} within the slime, it takes {@dice 8d6} additional acid damage and sinks into the slime. This spell treats creatures that cannot be {@condition prone} as if they are always {@condition prone} instead.

A {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to attempt to escape. It makes a Strength check against your spell save DC, with disadvantage if it has sunk into the lava. On a success, it frees itself and stands atop the slime.

The slime damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried, and it flows downhill and through holes or channels (at the DM's discretion) When the spell ends, the slime cools and hardens into black obsidian glass. The obsidian is broken wherever a creature would be trapped inside.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Caldera}}

spell.name: Storm Seizure
entries: You electrify the liquid inside one creature that you can see within range. The target is {@condition paralyzed} until the spell ends, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 7d10 + 30} lightning damage, or half as much damage on a success. Water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage and are never immune to this paralysis. The target makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.
This spell has no effect on creatures that are immune to cold damage, constructs, or plants. A creature killed by this spell is turned to ashes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Deep Freeze}}

spell.name: Titanic Flaming Sphere
entries: You evoke a massive orb of golden fire with a diameter of 20 feet at a point that you can see within range. It crashes into the ground then rolls up to 100 feet in a straight line to an unoccupied space.

Each creature in the orb's space when it appears or in its path when it rolls must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 10d12} fire damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. For the duration, you can use an action on your turn if you are within range of the orb to push it with magic, causing it to roll up to 100 feet in a straight line to an unoccupied space again.

The orb deals double damage to objects, but it can't roll through an object unless it deals enough damage to destroy the object. If the orb finishes its movement on an incline, it may roll downhill at the end of that turn (at the DM's discretion) rolling each turn until you use an action to roll it again or it reaches level ground.
The orb ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried as well as those that touch it.
The orb sheds bright light in a 100-foot radius and dim light for an additional 100 feet.
When the spell ends, the orb vanishes.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Megalith}}

spell.name: Avalanche
entries: A cascade of sand, boulders, gravel and jagged shards plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} piercing damage and {@damage 20d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Rizzak's Firestorm
entries: Orbs made of pure flame, but sparking with golden lightning plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} fire damage and {@damage 20d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Storm God's Decree
entries: A primordial storm of powerful lightning bolt and thundering sound plummets to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} lightning damage and {@damage 20d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Voracity
entries: Clouds of monstrous, aberrant teeth that splash with eldritch digestive acid plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} acid damage and {@damage 20d6} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one cloud is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Vorpal Icicles
entries: Massive jagged spikes of ice plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} cold damage and {@damage 20d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one icicle is affected only once.
The spell damages objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Meteor Swarm}}

spell.name: Glacial Tide

m.text: a diamond worth at least 800gp

entries: You conjure a wave of ice, snow and glacial water propelled by magical force in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its destructive path. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 11d10} cold damage and {@damage 11d10} force damage, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
Until the end of your next turn, the area becomes difficult terrain.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Obliteration Beam}}

spell.name: Landslide

m.text: a diamond worth at least 800gp

entries: You create a grinding wave of sand, dust and earth in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its destructive path. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 11d10} piercing damage and {@damage 11d10} bludgeoning damage, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Obliteration Beam}}

spell.name: Radiant Sunblast

m.text: a diamond worth at least 800gp

entries: You emit a massive beam of intense light in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its destructive path. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 22d10} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded}. .
Until the end of your next turn, the area emits bright light for 500 feet and dim light for an additional 500 feet.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Obliteration Beam}}

spell.name: Rizzak's Infernal Roar

m.text: a diamond worth at least 800gp

entries: You emit a massive beam made of roaring, turbulent flame from your throat in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its destructive path. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 11d10} fire damage and {@damage 11d10} thunder damage, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
Until the end of your next turn, the area emits bright light for 500 feet and dim light for an additional 500 feet.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area and ignites those that are flammable and aren't being worn or carried.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Obliteration Beam}}

spell.name: Thunderstorm Tornado

m.text: a diamond worth at least 800gp

entries: You emit a roaring cyclone filled with rumbling thunder and arcing lightning in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its destructive path. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 11d10} lightning damage and {@damage 11d10} thunder damage, is {@condition deafened}, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Obliteration Beam}}

spell.name: Light of Saber
entries: You evoke a whip-like cord of searing arcane light in your free hand. The whip sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet and lasts for the duration. If you let go of the whip, it disappears, but you can evoke the whip again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to lash out with the whip, which stretches and weaves between foes. Up to five targets of your choice that you can see within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d8} radiant damage and {@damage 5d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Objects automatically fail the saving throw.
Damage from this spell ignores resistance, and it ignores immunity to radiant damage when dealing damage to objects.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Plasma Coil}}

spell.name: Rizzak's Hell Lash
entries: You evoke a whip-like cord of lightning that burns with hellish flame in your free hand. The whip sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet and lasts for the duration. If you let go of the whip, it disappears, but you can evoke the whip again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to lash out with the whip, which stretches and weaves between foes. Up to five targets of your choice that you can see within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d8} lightning damage and {@damage 5d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Objects automatically fail the saving throw.
Damage from this spell ignores resistance, and it ignores immunity to lightning damage when dealing damage to objects.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Plasma Coil}}

spell.name: Induction
entries: You fill up to ten creatures of your choice that you can see within range with intense electricity. Creatures that are immune to lightning damage and constructs are unaffected.

Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 14d6} lightning damage and is {@condition stunned}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. If a target is killed by this damage, it fries to charred bits.
A {@condition stunned} target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the stunning effect ends.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Psychic Scream}}

spell.name: Starlight Judgment
entries: You invoke an astral or celestial judgment upon ten creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Creatures that have an Intelligence score of 2 or lower are unaffected.

Each target must make an Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 14d6} radiant damage and is {@condition stunned}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. If a target is killed by this damage, it vanishes in a flash of light.
A {@condition stunned} target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the stunning effect ends.
{@note This spell is a variant of {@spell Psychic Scream}}

entries.name: Awakened Plants
entries: An awakened plant is an ordinary plant given sentience and mobility by the awaken spell or similar magic. Their form and abilities vary depending on the type of plant that is awakened. Sometimes a specific plant is chosen because there are no better options available, but often they are chosen for a specific purpose.

Yet at times plants are awakened by magic controlled without a purpose, such as an elder treant that simply wishes to bring intelligence to plants at random. Other times the magic is uncontrolled, such as when a primal spring of life magic causes nearby plants of all kinds to spontaneously awaken, as happens in some jungles.
These awakened plants are to be used in addition to the {@creature awakened tree|MM} and {@creature awakened shrub|MM} that can already be found in the base rules.

entries.name: Celestials
entries: The Upper Planes are home to a variety of celestials that so embody the attributes of celestial light itself that their form resembles that of a primordial elemental, one composed of light instead of fire, earth, air, or water.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: These celestials don't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Elemental Spirits
entries: Smaller than the usual elemental, these spirits can be found not only wandering the Elemental Planes that they spawn from, but also the Feywild, Shadowfell, and Material Planes. While they are plentiful in their native planes, any encounter with these spirits outside of the Elemental Planes is rare and often cherished. Though not made of flesh, most have arms, torsos, faces, and sometimes even legs, though their forms are usually malleable and can be changed if needed.

entries.name: Not Quite Genie
entries: Elemental spirits are usually born when the soul of a sentient living creature melds with the primordial matter of an elemental plane and fails to manifest as a genie. The soul loses all characteristics in this magical rebirth. Since such manifestations are very rare, some say that there are as many as a thousand elemental spirits born for every genie that manifests. Spirits can even be born outside the Elemental Planes in places that resemble those planes, where a genie would never be able to manifest. They may appear in quarries, rivers, campfires, etc.

entries.name: Capricious and Playful
entries: Elemental spirits adore fun and whimsy. Since they don't need to eat or rest, they spend nearly all their time playing with each other when they aren't hiding from the world around them. These spirits flit from activity to activity, rarely staying still, and they are fascinated by anything they haven't seen before. They often make off with objects from humanoid settlements to entertain themselves. Many an adventuring group have awoken from a rest to find their campsite soaked in water, filled with recently dug holes, on fire, or scattered to the winds by these mischievous spirits.

entries.name: Unreliable Servants
entries: While they are much easier to summon than normal elementals and especially genies, these spirits are notoriously difficult to control. Their ability to hide and infiltrate small spaces makes them potentially excellent servants for many mages, but these benefits must be balanced against the certainty that some orders will be misunderstood or even willfully ignored. Still, making friends with these spirits can be worthwhile. They are difficult to understand and so they can be a challenge to please, but they form very strong bonds and always remember their friends.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: Elemental spirits don't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Fairy Swarms
entries: The most dangerous mistake one can make when interacting with a pixie, sprite, or scamp is not to underestimate the fairy—but to underestimate their friends.
When fairies group together for battle or other purposes, they can be represented in a quick and engaging way by managing their statistics as a swarm.

entries.name: Giants
entries: Giants are naturally distinguished by psuedo-elemental traits and categories. These massive beings sometimes display elemental magic in kind with their nature.

entries.name: Green Giants
entries: Among the forests, jungles, and sunlit valleys of not only the Material Plane but also the Feywild, green giants wander and rest alone or in small groups. Green giants are remarkably rare, friendly, and gentle giants. They rank between hill giants and stone giants in the Ordning of Giants, but they are so uncommon that they are often forgotten. The boulders they throw are often chunks of wood or amber, rather than pure rock.

entries.name: Verdant Green
entries: Green giants are green because their connection to the natural world manifests in a plant-like nature. Their green skin, which is as thick and tough as a tropical plant's hardy skin, is covered with small vines, leaves, moss, thorns, and other bits of flora. Their dark green hair can seem nearly black without good lighting, but it is usually threaded with leaves, flowers, and twigs. These giants begin their lives as giant seeds which must be planted in the ground and tended to for many years before finally emerging as green giant children.

Green giants prefer to live in areas that are as verdant as they themselves are. The forests and grasslands they inhabit are relatively abundant, and when their homes no longer suit them, they take a fallen tree as a walking staff and set out on a wandering journey to find a new forest. Despite their wide ranging habitats, these giants are so rare that many regard them as a myth. Most green giants are content to live their long lives without increasing their numbers or building families.

entries.name: Sunbathing Pacifists
entries: Green giants live lethargic and restful lives. They love basking in sunlight or soaking in clean water (preferably both at the same time} Rather than concern themselves with war, politics, gluttony, or knowledge, these giants exist peacefully and patiently, content to live in serene locations and appreciate the beauty inherent in nature. Green giants abhor violence, and they are so careful with their strength that they can pluck a tiny baby bird from the ground and return it to its nest without misplacing a single feather. When they must defend themselves or their lands from aggressors, green giants seek the aid of their friends and allies.

entries.name: Patient Cultivators
entries: Green giants enjoy tending to plants and animals in their verdant homes, such as deer, flowers, or songbirds. They treat their plants like beloved pets, and treat their animal friends like children.

Green giants are congenial and friendly, approaching relationships with other sentient beings with just as much patience and concern as they do with flora and fauna. Once a green giant has decided to befriend someone, they make regular visits every few months to speak with them, listening attentively and trying to aid them with the problems in their lives. They commonly make friends with farmers and hunters, but anyone that journeys through a secluded forest or jungle might catch the attention of a green giant and start a friendship that lasts long after they leave the area. Green giants watch their humanoid friends grow, learn, thrive, and flourish over the course of a humanoid lifetime, taking joy in the accomplishments of their friends.

entries.name: Wardens of the Forest
entries: Some green giants are less pacifistic than their fellows, and seek to use their innate strength and natural magic to defend the green places from those who would deforest and despoil them. They seek out elder treants, fey, and archdruids as teachers, seeking to learn how to harness their primal affinity to act as a warden of the forests, jungles, and other green places of the world. Combining their great might with primal magic, they watch as sentinels over their homes.

These wardens act as enforcers of an ancient natural law. When they apprehend villains, they try to reason with them and, if possible, exile them rather than slay them. Their efforts to prevent deforestation often bring them into conflict with fire giants. When these conflicts become large enough to threaten the Ordning, green giant wardens seek out good-hearted cloud giants and storm giants to help mediate the situation. Wardens are willing to undertake long journeys to seek aid when needed, leaving their domains to be defended by their allies for a time. These allies often include treants, fey, green elves, and even noble adventurers.

entries.name: Photosynthesis
entries: As a magical plant, green giants can feed themselves for the day without eating anything by staying in sunlight and clean water for at least 1 hour.

entries.name: Golem Armors
entries: Golem armors are special constructs designed to be controlled using magic by a humanoid pilot inside the armor itself. These constructs are usually conjured as part of the new {@spell golem armor|TEB} spell, but permanent golem armors can also be made via lengthy magical rituals. In some worlds, these giant armors serve as the vanguard of magical armies. In others, they are ancient weapons from a lost age that could turn the tide of many eternal conflicts. Most of them are thirty feet tan but ancients tell of armors that could touch the clouds.

entries.name: Operated by Magic
entries: Golem armors are designed to be operated by magic. A spellcaster near an empty golem armor can force it to open the hidden door in its chest and kneel to allow entry. Once inside, the mage stays in a shielded core, protected from the heat, cold, lightning, or other threats posed by the golem. This controller (sometimes called a pilot) can use any talent for magic they might possess to control the armor. As examples, a wizard would use their intellect, a druid or cleric would use their spirit, and not only sorcerers but even tieflings or anyone else with natural magic could use that same natural talent to control the armor.

entries.name: Constructed Nature
entries: A golem armor doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Hags
entries: Hags are fey known for their malevolence more than anything else, even beyond their penchants for alchemy, magic, and eldritch powers. They adore deception and destruction, and they sustain themselves by devouring humanoids. Hags make twisted bargains that sabotage their victims, and steal children away to consume or even transform into new hags.

entries.name: Hybrid Elementals
entries: The elemental planes of water, earth, fire, and air align on planar borders where two elements combine to form a new dual-element, such as earth and fire creating lava. These border zones give rise to new hybrid elementals made of these combined elements.

Sometimes a hybrid elemental can be formed when an elemental journeys to an elemental plane that it isn't native to and absorbs its energy. Most elementals are harmed by extended exposure to the other elemental planes, but surviving in one can enable an elemental to absorb its energy. A dual-elemental can even fuse with a third element and be reborn as a more powerful hybrid elemental made of three elements.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: These elementals don't require air, food, drink or sleep.

entries.name: Primal Spirit Avatars
entries: The wilderness in all its many forms—tundra, forest, desert, and other biomes—is not without awareness or agency. The land itself gives birth to mighty spirits, fey and elementals that are so ancient that they are largely forgotten except by the oldest in the multiverse. These primal spirits are all connected to a form of land, taking the shape of a plant or animal from their domains.

Though they are composed of powerful magic, these mighty spirits struggle to physically leave their ancient realms in some of the oldest parts of the Feywild: the savage wilds called the Spirit World. If their domains on the Material Plane are threatened, they project a weak reflection of their true nature, an avatar, to defend the land. These avatars take little effort for a primal spirit to controi and the spirit is not harmed if the avatar is slain.

entries.name: Incarnations of Ancient Titans
entries: The primal spirits are ancient beings that traversed the Feywild and the Material Plane when the world was young and the land was still forming. The spirits are each representations of the lands themselves. The majority of these spirits keep their ancient, true names a secret, though some are known by nicknames they have adopted for the benefit of mortals, such as Coyote or Greatmother Oak. Those nicknames have been used so often that they are now applied to any coyote or any oak tree, instead of merely the primal spirit, and the original names of these animals and plants have been lost.

entries.name: Druids Serve as Champions
entries: Primal spirits often require the aid of druids and archdruids to help defend their lands against despoilers. Druids can be trusted to act more swiftly and in more places than a spirit could possibly manage from their realm in the Feywild. Archdruids can wield powerful enough magic to summon an avatar of the spirit without effort from the spirit itself, but primal spirits trust very few with this privilege. They entreat carefully with archdruids and only select their favorite among them as a champion who can conjure their avatar to aid both their goals.

entries.name: Hatred for Despoilers
entries: The spirits of nature despise those that would despoil nature in any of its forms. Not all forms of consumption earn the spirits' ire: the spirits themselves are often predator or prey, and understand that survival often means destruction. They despise the reckless and sometimes gleeful destruction of nature that has nothing to do with survival and too much to do with mortal flaws such as greed, pride, or ambition. This is what the spirits consider to be "despoiling."

entries.name: Primal Nature
entries: A primal spirit avatar doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Summoning Eladrin as Primal Spirits
entries: The Seasonal Eladrin described in {@i Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes} are excellent choices from a lore and flavor perspective to be summoned as avatars by the new spell {@spell summon primal spirit|TEB}, but as CR l 0 creatures they can feel slightly lacking when compared to the full power of a CR 12 creature, and they already have Magic Resistance. If a DM wishes, they can use a modified form of those Eladrin as an avatar for summon primal spirit, adding the Magic Weapons trait and one usage of Legendary Resistance to bring each modified Eladrin to CR 12:

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/day)
entries: If the eladrin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Arctic Adaptation
entries: <$name$> is unbothered by the cold, and its natural frigidity protects it from rot, like permafrost, but it doesn't handle heat very well. It has resistance to cold damage and necrotic damage, but it has weakness 2 to fire damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Desert Adaptation
entries: <$name$> spends all its days under the blazing desert sun, and it eschews shade or cooling techniques, but it is weak to anything that might dehydrate or wither it. It has resistance to fire damage and radiant damage, but it has weakness 2 to necrotic damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Extreme Adaptation
entries: <$name$> has bizarre physiology that makes it capable of withstanding extreme temperatures, but its bodily processes are more easily disrupted by toxins. It has resistance to cold damage and fire damage, but it has weakness 2 to poison damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Mountain Adaptation
entries: <$name$> is used to the icy, lightning-swept mountains and peaks, but it isn't prepared to contend with the caustic waters of the lowlands. It has resistance to cold damage and lightning damage, but it has weakness 2 to acid damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Stormy Adaptation
entries: <$name$> lives mostly within dark hurricanes and thunderstorms, and it is not accustomed to shielding itself from the bright light of the sun. It has resistance to lightning damage and thunder damage, but it has weakness 2 to radiant damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Swamp Adaptation
entries: <$name$> is born of the most wretched of swamps, which has inured it to toxins and caustic water, but as the swamp rarely has storms it is weak to lightning. It has resistance to poison damage and acid damage, but it has weakness 2 to lightning damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Volcanic Adaptation
entries: <$name$> is native to an extremely hot region filled with volcanic activity, toxic ash clouds, and even lava, but it doesn't handle the cold well. It has resistance to fire damage and poison damage, but it has weakness 2 to cold damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Alchemically Reactive
entries: <$name$>'s body contains a substance that reacts explosively to strong acids. If it takes acid damage, it and each creature within 10 feet of it take fire damage equal to one-third of the acid damage dealt.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Highly Soluble
entries: <$name$> is easily dissolved by acids, like a rust golem. If it takes acid damage greater than or equal to 10 + its challenge rating, it must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC equals 12 or half the acid damage dealt, whichever is higher. On a failed saving throw, it loses a random limb. See the table in the {@spell petrify} spell (page 92) or the "{@table Lingering Injuries|DMG}" table in chapter 9 of the {@i Dungeon Master's Guide} for the effects of a lost limb.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Cold-Blooded
entries: <$name$> is easily exhausted in a cold environment. If it takes cold damage greater than or equal to 10 + its challenge rating, it gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and until the end of its next turn, its speed is reduced by 10 feet and it has disadvantage on the next weapon attack it makes. This {@condition exhaustion} is removed from a creature when it finishes a short or long rest in a warm environment.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Cold Fracture
entries: <$name$> is composed of materials that expand, crack, and break when chilled. If it takes cold damage greater than or equal to 10 + its challenge rating, it also takes bludgeoning damage equal to half the cold damage dealt.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Freeze
entries: <$name$> is made of something that freezes when chilled. If it takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: <$name$> has a deathly fear of flame, such as an {@creature oblex|MM} or a {@creature flesh golem|MM}. If the creature takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Flammable
entries: <$name$> is easily set on fire. If it takes fire damage greater than or equal to 10 + its challenge rating, it is lit ablaze. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, it takes fire damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + half its challenge rating at the start of each of its turns.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Melt
entries: <$name$> is made of wax or another substance that melts easily, but not as easily as ice. If it takes fire damage, it becomes gooey; its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Thaw
entries: <$name$> is held together by ice or another substance that melts easily, leaving weaker substances beneath. If it takes fire damage, it partially thaws; its speed is reduced by 10 feet and its AC is reduced by 1 until the end of its next turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Conductive Melting
entries: <$name$> conducts electricity so well that the energy melts its body easily, like a copper golem. If it takes lightning damage greater than or equal to 10 + its challenge rating, it partially melts into a molten material. For 1 minute, its speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Strength checks, and it deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength, but it deals fire damage equal to half its challenge rating to any creatures grappling it at the start of each of its turns. It makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The DC equals 12 or half the lightning damage dealt, whichever is higher.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Electrical
entries: <$name$> is powered or controlled by a mysterious system of artifice and lightning energy. If it takes lightning damage, it suffers a cumulative -2 penalty to attack rolls and ability checks and its speed is reduced by 5 feet until the end of its next turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Magnetic
entries: <$name$> is magnetized by electricity. If it takes lightning damage, it becomes magnetic until the end of its next turn. While magnetic, its speed is halved while walking on a metal surface, it has disadvantage on melee attacks made against targets wearing metal armor, attacks using metal weapons have disadvantage against it, and it is pulled 10 feet toward the nearest metal object that is larger than it at the start of each of its turns.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Ocular Being
entries: <$name$> is mostly made of eyes or even a single eye that is weak to bright lights. If it takes radiant damage greater than or equal to 10 + its challenge rating, it is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. It makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The DC equals 12 or half the radiant damage dealt, whichever is higher.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: <$name$> is accustomed to pure darkness, like a drow. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: <$name$> is burned by sunlight, like a vampire. It takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Hard of Hearing
entries: <$name$> has difficulty hearing and is easily deafened by loud sounds. If it takes thunder damage, it is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn, and it has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing for 1 minute.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Resonant
entries: <$name$> is easily vibrated by strong sounds, causing its body to lock up momentarily. If it takes thunder damage, it vibrates uncontrollably; its speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Sonic Vulnerability
entries: <$name$>'s exceptional hearing also makes it weak to sonic attacks. If it takes thunder damage greater than or equal to 10 + its challenge rating, it must make a Constitution saving throw. The DC equals 12 or half the thunder damage dealt, whichever is higher. On a failed saving throw, it is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Darkness Susceptibility
entries: <$name$> is made of light, or something else that is smothered by darkness. For every 5 feet the creature moves in darkness, it takes 2 necrotic damage. When the creature ends its turn within darkness, it takes 10 necrotic damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Despised by the Sea
entries: <$name$> is said to be hated by water and the ocean. While it is submerged in water, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the start of its next turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Fluid-Powered
entries: <$name$> is animated by a particular fluid, such as water or lava. While the creature is not submerged in the fluid, it is an object.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Gas Intolerant
entries: <$name$> requires very clean air, like someone with poor health or a spirit of cleanliness. When the creature starts its turn within dust, gas, or vapor, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or spend its action that turn retching and reeling and have its speed reduced by half for that turn.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: <$name$> is magically harmed by running water, like a vampire. It takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Leaking Fluid
entries: <$name$> is filled with an animating fluid, such as water or oii that leaks out of its body when it leaves the substance. When the creature ends its turn not submerged in the fluid, it takes 2 necrotic damage and its speed is reduced by 5 feet until it returns to the fluid.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Planar Susceptibility
entries: <$name$> is wounded by planar travel. When the creature teleports (willingly or not), it takes {@dice 1d6} force damage for every 5 feet it travels. If it moves from one plane to another, it takes 50 force damage, or only 15 force damage if it moved from the Ethereal Plane or to it.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Salt Susceptibility
entries: <$name$> is dehydrated when it touches salt, like a slug. For every 5 feet the creature moves across salt, or for every pound of salt thrown onto it, it takes 2 necrotic damage.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Unwieldy Height
entries: <$name$> is so tall and precariously balanced that gravity itself threatens it. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets that are more than two sizes smaller than it. If the creature is knocked {@condition prone} when it wasn't already {@condition prone}, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to twice its challenge rating that ignores its resistances.

makebrewCreatureTrait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: <$name$> is made of something cleansed, dissolved, or doused by water. For every 5 feet the creature moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage if doused, or 1 acid damage otherwise.
